decks.notes: This control Nic Fit deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards, removal spells, and efficient creatures, while ramping up mana with Veteran Explorer and Green Sun's Zenith to cast powerful finishers like Primeval Titan and Dragonlord Dromoka. The deck utilizes a toolbox of creatures to adapt to various situations, such as Gaddock Teeg for spell-heavy decks and Eternal Witness to recur important spells. Pernicious Deed serves as a versatile board wipe, while Deathrite Shaman provides extra utility and graveyard hate. The deck aims to outvalue opponents over the long game.

The deck focuses on quickly putting a powerful creature into play by utilizing cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to bypass traditional casting costs. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans using counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm while searching for the right pieces with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm. By utilizing powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from playing their spells through the use of cards like Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Trinisphere. By locking down the opponent's resources, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Magus of the Moon to win the game before the opponent can recover. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful burn spells like Fiery Confluence and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to finish off opponents or clear the way for its creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, Ghost Quarter, Wasteland, and Maze of Ith, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from developing their board. The key combo in this deck revolves around Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. By using cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration, the deck can quickly assemble this combo while grinding out value with cards like Punishing Fire and Manabond.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. Then, use spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a big advantage. Cabal Therapy and Unmask help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal provide fast mana acceleration to execute the combo efficiently. The deck focuses on reanimating big threat creatures early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this Aluren combo deck is to utilize the Aluren enchantment along with creatures like Shardless Agent, Cavern Harpy, and Baleful Strix to create a loop that allows you to play creatures for free or at a reduced cost. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, as well as value creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Grim Flayer. The goal is to control the board, disrupt your opponent's strategy, and combo off to win the game quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, manipulating the top of the deck, and utilizing board wipes. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance, while also utilizing card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm and Predict. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats. The win condition is to eventually resolve powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and create a board presence with Entreat the Angels.

This Combo - Storm deck aims to generate a massive amount of mana quickly using rituals and Lotus Petals, then draw through the deck for key combo pieces with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The goal is to cast Ad Nauseam to draw into a win condition like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. Duress and Cabal Therapy help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing valuable information for Infernal Tutor. The deck's success hinges on efficiently executing the Storm mechanic to overwhelm the opponent in a single turn.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes various cards like Crop Rotation, Expedition Map, and Sylvan Scrying to search for the combo pieces efficiently. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo from being disrupted by the opponent. Additionally, cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide provide fast mana acceleration to help achieve the combo as quickly as possible.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies using counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes while maintaining card advantage and controlling the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics to further disrupt opponents and slow down their game plan. The deck aims to control the battlefield and outvalue opponents through resource management and careful decision-making, ultimately grinding out a win through superior control and card advantage.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by quickly deploying powerful threats such as Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, which can lock opponents out of their key cards. It also utilizes aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Pia and Kiran Nalaar to pressure opponents and close out games quickly. With a focus on mana denial and punishing greedy mana bases, this deck looks to control the board and limit the opponent's options while overwhelming them with efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off with elves by using cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. Glimpse of Nature allows for card draw and explosive turns, while Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger help with untapping creatures for mana and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Deathrite Shaman and Reclamation Sage to interact with the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built around Gaea's Cradle to generate large amounts of mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn.

The key concept of this deck is to use artifacts to quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing cards such as Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Vault Skirge to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. With fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, as well as disruptive lands like Wasteland, the deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive elements.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats early on. By combining disruptive cards like Wasteland, Force of Will, Daze, Brainstorm, and Cabal Therapy with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and put pressure on the opponent. This deck seeks to quickly establish board presence and chip away at the opponent's life total before they can stabilize and mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack to quickly put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for free. The deck also includes cards like Omniscience and Cunning Wish to provide alternative win conditions and protect your key combo pieces. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Flusterstorm, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and win the game in a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and cards with fast spells like Dark Ritual and Rite of Flame, then use Infernal Tutor or Burning Wish to find and cast the key combo piece, Ad Nauseam. Ad Nauseam lets the player draw their whole deck for a storm count finish with cards like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win by casting a high storm count spell for lethal damage.
